meanings.definition: To open or remove a seal from something.
meanings.sent1: She unseals the letter carefully to read the message inside.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith unseals the door to rescue the trapped cat.
meanings.sent3: After much struggle, he finally unseals the stubborn jar of pickles.
meanings.sent4: The sun unseals the buds on the flowers, bringing color to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The detective unseals the evidence envelope to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To reveal or disclose something previously hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The magician unseals the secret compartment to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent2: The whistleblower unseals the truth about the corrupt company practices.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map unseals the location of the hidden chest.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unseals the joy within her heart, brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll unseals the forgotten history of the kingdom.
